intro: Tuberolabium papuanum, commonly known as the Papuan tuber-labium, is a flowering plant native to New Guinea. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its unique tuberous roots and showy, fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories, where it thrives in humid and cool conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
